reviews.review_text: Guys, don‚Äôt waste your money on a Dyson! I tried my friend‚Äôs Dyson, and believe me, it gives the same results as the Shark FlexStyle. The FlexStyle is versatile, lightweight, and delivers salon-quality styles at home, whether I‚Äôm curling, straightening, or adding volume with its different attachments. It is a bit tricky to use at first, but once you get the hang of it, you‚Äôll love it. Just make sure your hair is at least 70% dry and avoid using conditioner, as it can make your curls not last as long. I recommend using a lightweight leave-in conditioner instead. The only other downside is switching the barrel, but I won‚Äôt spend $400 more just for a barrel switch and a little less noise. The Shark FlexStyle does everything the Dyson does, and it‚Äôs totally worth it for the price and performance!

reviews.review_text: As a hairdresser I‚Äôve been debating buying this for a while now. I figured I have so many tools why do I need this.  I finally caved and decided to purchase it and it‚Äôs quite a great product.  If you are looking for a Dyson dupe then this is it.  It‚Äôs very user friendly and is not complicated to use even with all the add ons and bits and bobs.  I have fine hair but allot of it with added extensions for length and volume and I got a great blowdry with this tool in under 45 minutes. Unfortunately my hair never held style well so It fell within the hour so I  still will need to use a hot tool on top of this product.  A great product that is easy to use and helps styling air allot easier.  However a few things I wish were different. One is the  handle.  I find it‚Äôs just a little thick and has an awkward feel in the hand.  The bristles on the blowdry brush attachments are a little thin. I do think they could be a little bit thicker to get more grip on the hair.  And I wish they included a little bag or some sort of travel pouch to keep everything together and for storage.  Nothing fancy but just to keep everything together.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have curly hair (3a). I tried this with a tried and true heat protectant/de-frizzimg serum, and while it dried my hair pretty fast and get it somewhat straightened with a curled ends, I could not get my hair completely smooth, it still had quite a bit of frizz. I tried both the oval, and paddle brush attachment, and while it would look smooth for a few seconds, it would then start to frizz, so I needed to use my chi flat iron to go over it. For $349.99, I don't want to have to use another tool. My hair also had the burned smell, before using my flat iron, probably because of how many times I kept going over it to get it smooth. That also made skeptical about less heat damage claim. It might work better for me in the winter, with no humidity, but again for $349.99, I want something that will be successful all year round. I gave it 3 stars for the quick drying and to acknowledge it just might be my hair texture that it doesn't work well for, but maybe a really great tool for others.  I might try the shark smooth style and see if I have better luck with that.

reviews.review_title: Shark FlexStyle: Curl Mastery for All-Day Glam!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've got thin, fine hair, but with the Shark FlexStyle, I'm ready to roll in just about 2 minutes! It's a real time-saver. Now, those curling attachments took me a bit to get the hang of, but I've cracked the code for curls that last all day. The trick? Start with hair that's still a tad damp. Trust me, using the curler on dry hair just doesn't cut it. For extra staying power, I pin up each curl after I make it, letting the hair cool in that perfect curl shape for even longer. Then, a spritz of lightweight hairspray while they're still pinned up, and when you're ready to hit the town, just shake out those curls for a fab finish!
